intro: Actinocephalus glareosus, commonly known as the shining starflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that are typically bright yellow or orange. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
